column4: hy i am trying to  mount -t vfat /media/windows/ /dev/hda5 and i get this error: mount: /media/windows/ is not a block device
then i get this error mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on /dev/hda5,
: is it possible that theres a problem with the drive?
: a bad superblock indicates that theres an issue reading from the drive.  You can try running dosfsck to find/fix errors, but in my experience this sometimes leads to futher corrupting the data
it doesn't maeter i just formated that drive
: try sudo dosfsck /dev/devicename -a    This will automatically attempt to fix any issues with the drive, you can then try to mount it
I get this Currently, only 1 or 2 FATs are supported, not 21.
not working:( e2fsck: Bad magic number in super-block while trying to open /dev/hda5
